column2: Walmart, Inc. engages in retail and wholesale business. The company is headquartered in Bentonville, Arkansas and currently employs 2,200,000 full-time employees. The firm offers an assortment of merchandise and services at everyday low prices (EDLP). The firm operates through three segments: Walmart U.S., Walmart International and Sam's Club. The Walmart U.S. segment includes the Company's mass merchant concept in the United States operating under the Walmart brands, as well as digital retail. The Walmart International segment consists of the Company's operations outside of the United States, including various retail Websites. The Sam's Club segment includes the warehouse membership clubs in the United States, as well as samsclub.com. The firm operates approximately 11,600 stores under 59 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce Websites in 11 countries.
